metadata.title: CVE-2023-1855 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - low
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in xgene_hwmon_remove indrivers/hwmon/xgene-hwmon.c in the Hardware Monitoring Linux Kernel Driver(xgene-hwmon). This flaw could allow a local attacker to crash the systemdue to a race problem. This vulnerability could even lead to a kernelinformation leak problem.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1855` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.3.0-7.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.3.0-7.7.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.3.0-7.7.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.3.0-7.7').
linux-aws package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
